feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued August 24 at 8:03AM AKDT until August 25 at 4:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TO 4 PM AKDT THURSDAY FROM KIPNUK TO THE MOUTH OF THE KUSKOKWIM RIVER... The National Weather Service in Anchorage has issued a High Surf Advisory, which is in effect from 7 AM to 4 PM AKDT Thursday. * LOCATION...The southern Kuskokwim Delta Coastline, from Kipnuk to the mouth of the Kuskokwim River

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 4:10AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RISING WATER LEVELS ON SMALL STREAMS AND CREEKS DRAINING THE BROOKS RANGE... A series of fronts will impact the region, bringing copious amounts of widespread rain that will cause water levels to rise on small streams and creeks draining the south slopes of the Western Brooks Range.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 4:10AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED SURF THURSDAY AND FRIDAY... Strong south winds to 25 to 35 mph will move into the West Coast and bring elevated surf to parts of Norton Sound and the Yukon Delta on Thursday, persisting into Friday before they diminish. Wave action will combine with storm surge and be the greatest along south facing coastlines, with anticipated storm surge
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; Yukon Delta

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 2:37PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Glacier Dammed lake release causing debris to flow into Controller Bay... Satellite observations indicate that the Berg glacier dammed lake, located 65 miles east of Cordova, has likely released downstream into the Gandil River, Bering River and Bering Lake. High water from this glacier dammed lake release usually lasts for several days with large areas

entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by elevated river levels will continue into the weekend. * WHERE...The mainstem Kenai River is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. * WHEN...Until 500 PM AKDT Saturday.

Trinity River Near Rosser affecting Ellis and Kaufman Counties. Trinity River At Dallas affecting Dallas County. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/fwd.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 5:17AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 105 AND 109 DEGREES ARE EXPECTED TODAY... The combination of warm temperatures and high dewpoints will produce heat indices between 105 and 109 degrees today. Residents with outdoor activities planned are urged to drink plenty of water, wear light weight and light colored clothing and take frequent breaks from the heat. Young children and pets should never be left

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 10:40AM CDT until August 25 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Texas... Trinity River Near Rosser affecting Kaufman and Ellis Counties. For the Trinity River...including Dallas, Rosser, Trinidad, Long Lake (Oakwood)...elevated river levels are forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.

entry.title: Flood Watch issued August 24 at 6:36AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: .A slow moving low pressure system will support afternoon thunderstorms. The storms will be stationary to slow moving, allowing for heavy rain amounts over small areas causing flash flooding. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM PDT THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING...

entry.title: Heat Advisory issued August 24 at 3:35AM PDT until August 26 at 12:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO MIDNIGHT PDT THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Hot conditions with temperatures in the mid 80s to low 90s expected. This will pose a moderate risk of heat-related illness. * WHERE...Northwest Interior, Everett and Vicinity, Tacoma Area,

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 1:29PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...REDUCED VISIBILITIES FROM FOG CONTINUE IN PORTIONS OF DULUTH... Low stratus off Lake Superior moving up the hill in Duluth is causing localized reduced visibilities which pose a hazard to motorists. Anyone on the road should be prepared for quickly lowering visibilities.

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued August 24 at 3:13AM CDT until August 24 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Dangerous swimming conditions are expected along the Lake Superior shoreline due to high wave action and strong rip currents. * WHERE...Minnesota Park Point and Wisconsin Point Beaches.
